Summary: My family stayed in a family suite (3 beds, one in the bedroom and 2 in the main room). The motel has free parking and is walking distance from Disney, although the #43 and 543 buses stop nearby and are a quick and cheap way to save your feet. There is a small fridge and a microwave in the room, but no cutlery or crockery. We bought some disposable ones from the supermarket as we were trying to eat in to save money, it would’ve been great to have some basics provided. The room itself was dated but clean and tidy; housekeeping was great. The beds were on the hard side but after a long day at Disney, I could’ve slept on the floor for all I cared.  At half the price of a hotel around the corner, and a room twice the size, this is a great option if you’re on a budget and don’t care

Summary Heading: Great Inn for a trip to Disneyland.
Summary: We slept there for two nights while visiting Disneyland. It's not close to the park, but it is a 10 minute walk.  Our room was very big, in fact It had a smaller room inside. The beds were confortable, even though one if them made a strange noise. The receptionist was very nice.  And they also let us using their parking while un Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Clean, efficient and gets the job done
Summary: If you're the kind of traveler who believes hotels are just a place for sleeping, this is the place for you--and I don't mean that negatively.   We stayed here for four nights for the NAMM trade show, and it fit the bill perfectly. The rooms are basic but clean, reasonably spacious, and with updated (budget) modern style. The fridge and microwave let us make our own breakfast, and the location provided for a cheap Lyft ride to the Convention Center. There's a desk for getting your work done and good wi-fi. You're the best judge of whether you need or want more, but for us, it got the job done.

Some reviews and pics make this place look awful, and I’ll admit I fully thought we were going to stay in a dump. I told my husband to expect nothing. I was really pleasantly surprised. The hotel is easy to get to, and we walked to Disneyland (about 10-15 minutes). It’s next to a gas station so you can get snacks.   It’s a vintage style hotel with long balcony’s and flowers running on the wall. It looks kitschy and charming. The staff was nice when we checked in. The room was big (we had a room on the second floor at the end). They have room service too, which we didn’t expect.   Ok so for the room it’s fine. It’s nice lovely, it’s barely nice, it’s just fine. Very basic Motel 6 fine. The bed is thin, the comforter is probably gross, lights are weird, walls are thin, it’s not

Clean great parking and not very far from Disneyland quiet except during the fireworks show on the other hand very good place to watch the fireworks from, very nice and helpful staff, would stay here again

Summary Heading: I’m not sure the extra bed is worth it
Summary: The best thing about this hotel is the brief amount of time you will be there if going to Disney. It is so odd how much is worn down and outright broken. Our towel rack was taped together, the hair dryer plug was broken apart  with the wires hanging out, and the rest is just tired looking. A value means something different to me. Things should at a base level be in working order. Spend a little more folks.

The hotel is within walking distance of Disney - it takes about 20mins. There is a Starbucks on the way for breakfast. Look - you get what you pay for - this is a cheaper hotel than a lot in the area but perfectly adequate. Let's face it, if you're going to Disney, all you'll be doing is sleeping in the rooms and this was perfect for that. The staff were very nice and chatty. Free parking & Wi-Fi and you can see the Disney fireworks from the parking lot, pool and some rooms. Thank you.

Good and quiet. Nice front desk staff. 20 min walk from Disneyland. You can see fireworks from hotel. Walking distance from Starbucks (1 block), 5 min walk from fast food and supermarket. We felt safe walking at night.

Called Red lion hello rewards # to book my stay at Americas best value inn Astoria on June 21-June 22.received several confirmation reservation emails.When I arrived at the hotel the woman told me she never received any notice about my reservation and they were sold out.The hotel send me away.

We paid about $100 per night (after taxes etc) on a recent trip to Disneyland.  The rooms were spacious and clean, the check-in took a little long, but they people are very nice.  However, be warned that these rooms are BARE BONES.  We stayed with family, so we had 2 rooms side by side.  There were 7 of us.  We were so sad that we could not visit in each others room because the only place to sit was the bed!  There was one chair, no table, and little furniture to set things on.  They had fridges that were warm and missing shelves so we couldn't store food in them without it falling over. They don't offer breakfast -- not even a cup of coffee, and the shuttle was a bust -- took forever for it to come (even though they told us that it came and went every 15-20 minutes).  We ended
Room tip: They are all pretty much the same.

Summary: the power was off sunday nite from 11-4am.  it was an anaheim thing for the whole street but they never warned us.  i went to inquire about it and they just kept repeating that they told booking.com and booking.com sent me a message.  well i didnt book through booking.com so i didnt get the message.  the next day i asked the woman about it and she said they emailed everyone but i didnt get the email and got tired of hearing the same thing repeated over and over.they must teach the innkeepers to repeat like that so the customer gets tired of argueing and leaves defeated.  they should have told all guests at check in at least. NO A/C, NO REFRIGERATOR, NO SMOKE DETECTORS, NO TV, NO CLOCKS, NO INTERNET, NO LITES. i went into the cold jacuzzi and now my bathing suit is black, i guess

Rooms were clean, fridge worked so no problem with no breakfast here, super friendly staff, very accommodating.  AC didn't work in first room, so we were moved and given a discount. Sold shuttle tickets to D-land, but you could walk if you wanted! Added them to bill so nothing to fuss about.  Hot tub/ pool OK -  Could see the D-land fireworks from the balcony (we faced the park).  Used washer/dryer for clothes so convenient.  Nice budget place.

Summary Heading: Excellent location, clean rooms, helpful staff
Summary: The rooms are very clean, the property is well maintained, and it's in an excellent location--there's even a bus stop right in front of the hotel that takes you right to Disney!  While cleanliness and location are top on my list, I have to say the Astoria Inn hotel staff are exceptional.  They were helpful, knowledgeable, and attentive to our  needs.  I've stayed in other hotels in the Disney area but I can say for certain that we will be making Astoria Inn our regular place to stay when we take our kids to Disney or other attractions in the area.  And oh, I forgot to mention that there's a Starbucks within a very short walking distance from the hotel--perfect way to start the day!

Very clean, everything looked fairly new. Really close to Disneyland fireworks had an excellent view. Conveniently located within feet of Starbucks, gas station, convenient store, and Taco Bell. Staff was friendly. No complaints.

Very nice rooms, and easy to get to from the highway.  Comfortable beds, clean bathroom and large television. Watched the Disney fireworks show from the window! Parking was a little tight, but otherwise perfect! Bonus-  Starbucks right next door!

15 mins walk to Disneyland,  friendly staff. Large room, no basin in the bathroom.   Quite noisey with people walking past your room. Also water noise from the adjacent bathroom was quite loud, take your ear plugs and you'll be fine!   ................

Summary Heading: Clean, Quiet and close to Disney
Summary: Clean, quiet and close to Disney.  It's not a hotel where you want to hang out all day but it is in a good location and is clean for a very good price.  The staff was really nice.  We used it just for sleeping as we visited Disney and watched some Angels baseball.  Bring your own pillow theirs are ok.  The beds wont win an award but I've been to more expensive hotels that have been worse.

My daughter and I had an amazing trip. The staff was wonderful and so helpful. The price is perfect and the rooms are spacious and clean. We were easily able to walk to Disney but the ART shuttle is fast and easy for the way home when legs are tired! Such a wonderful place to stay will for sure boom again for my next Disney trip!

We, of course, were going to Disneyland, and arrived early -- around 9 a.m. -- way ahead of our scheduled check-in at 2 p.m. The clerk, a young man, checked us in (without giving us keys) and said we can park in the lot. We did, made our way to Disneyland, and as it goes, stayed until about 11 p.m. We returned at midnight and, lo and behold, the same gentleman was there. He hadn't been there all day, but he was just beginning his shift again. He gave us our keys and we were set. Very friendly guy. My only qualm with the room was that there were no outlets near the left bed and the floor was somewhat grimy (so wear socks). The bed was a hard, as well, but I slept like a baby (probably because of the 12 hours spent at Disney). Overall, would recommend as a 'budget' hotel only half

Summary Heading: Great value easy walk to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in room 112 which is a family room with 2 queen beds in the main room and another queen bed in a seperate room. Positives are the extra room, comfortable beds, a bath, walking distance to the theme parks, Walmart and fast food restaurants also next door to Starbucks. There are also nightly  views of fireworks. Negatives you can easily hear people in other rooms although they are also likely to be visiting the parks and going to bed early to get up early. Room for improvement would be towel rains and hooks on the doors to hang towels.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney - But Needs Updating
Summary: Love that it's only a 15-20 minute walk to Disney and that they have a shuttle stop in front, but the bathroom was definitely in need of updating. The shower head was super low. I'm 5'2" and even I had to bend a little.   The staff are really nice, they opened the pool early for us, though the pool looked like it could use some cleaning. There was also a dead bug floating in the hot tub. Also a little concerning was that their pool warning/info lacked a lot of information such as phone numbers and pool hours. They basically just posted the sign, but never filled it out.   Overall I give it 4 stars for being a 2 star hotel. Next time we will probably go for something better, but for a 2 night stay, this was place was pretty nice.

Great location within walking distance to Disneyland. You can see the Disney fireworks from every room in the hotel. Many fast food restaurants within walking distance and a Walmart just up the road. Our room was very spacious, however it was in desperate need of an update. The bedspread and valance were quite grubby with many marks visible on them. There was a bath, but no plug, so we were unable to use??? The bottom of the bath had a large stain which was just because it was so old. I've noticed other reviews remarking about the complimenty breakfast. It wasn't on offer whilst we were there. Not sure why? The reason I gave this hotel three stars is because the managers were so friendly and that I got a cheap rate. The free Wifi was also quite good.

When one chooses "value" over "comfort", one should expect the basic essentials. Which is what America's Best Value is - a better than average, "bear necessities" stop-gap for your trip to Disneyland.  The rooms are well kept, the location is only a 15 minute slow walk to Disneyland and it is close to a few good restaurants, as well as Starbucks. The inn also has a swimming pool, but we didn't use it at all. It also has parking, and "breakfast"... If you can call it that. You're better off having breakfast at nearby restaurants or supplying your own.  If you're too lazy to walk there's also transport right outside the inn. And if you haven't booked your Disneyland tickets online, you can get them at a discount rate from the receptionist. We were a little suspicious, but we were

We just landed after a 12hour flight from NZ and David was very welcoming and friendly. Check in was a breeze and we were offered information and tips. The have a $5 all day shuttle to Disneyland  but we walked it in 15min.  The rooms were lovely and tidy, very spacious!  There is a pool and spa but we used neither as we were exhausted after our day at the parks.  Our room had multiple towels, microwave, fridge, coffee, plastic cups and shampoo etc. very handy for those travelling  light! WIFI connected  straight away and was speedy.  Overall we would  definitely  stay here again and recommend to friends.

Our family stayed here for a few days at Disneyland. It was about a 15 minute walk to the park, but a shuttle was available. Not much of a breakfast other than a few muffins, coffee and orange juice. McDonald's and a few restaurants are only blocks away. Very courteous staff, very quiet night's sleep, Disneyland fireworks are visible from the balcony. The pool and hot tub are sufficient. Highly recommend this location.

Clean spacious room with fridge, microwave, and safe.  Has outdoor pool and hot tub.  Five minute drive to Disneyland.  Breakfast consist of only muffins, juice and coffee, which is fine with us.  Close to fast food and Walmart grocery store.

Summary Heading: Good value for what you pay
Summary: We stayed with three adults couples and only was there to sleep in between two days at Disneyland. Was clean and comfortable enough to sleep in... Would do it again in a heartbeat. Not much for breakfast but just enough to get a little bit before hitting the park again.

Just across I5 from Disneyland, we found a relative treasure. We reserved less than a week ahead, and they had a two bedroom three queen bed suite. The best surprise was the price, less than $100.  Clean, comfy, with two large-screen televisions. What more could you ask?   OK, I'll tell you. We reserved a mobility impared room. The problem was in the bathroom. A wheelchair can get in there, and it is even possible to sit on the toilet. Getting back up, however, is a whole different problem. No bars, no handles, and a very low toilet. A trap for the unwary. And then, there is the black mold on the bathroom floor. And in the shower. Bummer, especially for the sensitive child in all of us.  This is a really well located motel; but we will not be staying here again.

I was concerned with the cockroach reviews from earlier guest but we had no problems. It's probably because we visited in Jan versus hot summer months. The room was clean and fine for the price and we had no problems. Drains were really slow and I wouldn't recommend showering. I didn't during my short stay. The mattresses are definitely very firm so if you know that will bother you bring some plush blankets. I got a room with wood floor which made the room seem clean. I know they do offer carpet as well so I would request wood flooring. The bathroom with the toilet and tub are definitely old and moldy but not a huge concern

I stayed at this hotel after leaving Disneyland with the family and complete exhaustion. Our room seemed to be very bare and had very poor lighting. The mattresses were a little too hard for my comfort. They announce a free continental breakfast but they were only serving coffee and donuts. Not the best in terms of services and probably only good for a short stay.

Great value: Big, comfortable clean room with a very good location. We took a 5/10 mins bus to go to Disneyland. The breakfast is not good though, it consisted on coffee and cupcakes. For a budget room, this is a very good option.

Summary Heading: Great Value, Quite Possible America's Best Value!
Summary: A fifteen minute walk from Disneyland, America's Best Value is a great little place to stay. It's conveniently located near a mart, Starbucks, some nice restaurants (Mimi's Cafe in particular) and is quiet enough after a day's fun at Disneyland. The rooms are small, but clean, and the FREE WIFI (because it's important for us new-age folk), though slow, is good enough to check emails and a bit of Youtube. The staff are friendly, and even go out of their way to get you discounted Disneyland tickets and great deals on shuttle bus services to LAX Airport.  The only complaint I have is the "continental breakfast" they offer. Cupcakes, coffee and juice only? More like "continental rip-off"! At least it's located near some great restaurants, but this particular part prevents me from

The service was fantastic. The staff was super friendly. The rooms Were clean and spacious. The location was convenient because it's close to a Starbucks and shopping center. I definitely recommend to anyone who is on a budget , but still wants great service.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel for a Cheap Price
Summary: This hotel was exactly what we needed. We were at a convention over the weekend so only really used the hotel for sleeping but it was great. The room was clean and relatively spacious. The TV didn't work but we didn't mind. The staff were great. Breakfast consisted of juice, pastries and donuts served in reception. You get what you pay for. It's not the height of luxury but the location was great and it was exactly what we wanted for the price. Would recommend it :)

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: The location is great it's about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland, though I wouldn’t recommend walking to the parks with children. Rooms were spacious and cleaned daily (when requested). The television was old and missing buttons (dangerous for curious little ones). On our last night we found two large cockroaches, one in the bathtub and another crawling the bedroom wall. Management switched us rooms, however that room wasn't any better. Overall the hotel needs some major updating, particularly the bathrooms. The bathrooms had mold and missing tiles. I would recommend paying the extra money and sleeping comfortably without the fear of having cockroaches crawl on you.

There was 3 good points for this place; the shuttle stop was in front of the hotel. it is so close to Disneyland we were able to watch the fireworks from the room, and the night clerk was very helpful.  Unfortunately, nothing else was positive. The beds were horrid  and after a log day at Disneyland a good (not a great) bed is a must. Bad bathrooms, no exhaust fan ,toilet made scary noise after flushed. Maid staff poor, 1 of the 2 days of our stay, our room was not serviced. the outside of the hotel was dirty, and had exposed wiring( safety issues). The continental breakfast is a joke. a bag of bread, a toaster, doughnuts from the box store, and a jug of old orange juice is not going to get anyone through the morning. Less than basic cable.....no ESPN.  would we stay there

its as good as any ive been to.  and the cheapest this trip.  its a comfortable walk to disneyland and an easy shuttle back.  the shuttle is 5 a day , but seniors and disabled is 1 dollar per trip.  it has free parking.  clean room

Summary Heading: Adequate, but in need of renovation
Summary: Location is good for visiting the Disney Parks.  Room was spacious and having a fridge and microwave was a plus.  While it wasn't immaculate, it wasn't dirty either.  The motel has seen its better days, the plumbing probably hasn't been improved in decades.  Use the sink or shower once and the entire gets flooded for example.  But for the price, can't complain.  Adequate for a night or two.

We stayed in Room 108 for 3 nights.  Overall, this room was simply disgusting. Every surface and wall had some sort of damage, stain, or other issue. Honestly, the only good thing I can say about the place is that it did not have bed bugs.  We have stayed at many lower priced motels over the years, and don’t expect Hilton-quality when we are spending $45 a night, but we do expect cleanliness and a room free of safety hazards. This property failed to provide these basics.  Mold in bathroom, on tile grout in shower area and on wall where sheetrock was crumbling and damaged.  Light switches in bathroom were right next to shower, and got wet when taking a shower no matter how carefully we closed the curtain. Definitely a code violation.  Carpets were filthy. Walking on them for a

If you stay here thinking its going to be like a resort property or a 5 star hotel then you are going to be disappointed!This motel is exactly what it advertises to be a somewhat clean, affordable place to rest your weary body after a day of playing at the park. The staff was accommodating to several request i had (they let me keep my car their on checkout day until the park closed that night at 10 for instance). If you are looking for luxury, stay someplace else. If you are on a budget and don't mind a 10 minute walk to the park then this is the place for you! All in all i would stay here again.

Summary Heading: We got what we paid for...
Summary: We came in early on a Friday and was told the room wasn't ready but that we should be all checked in and ready by the time we returned from the park.. Cool right? Uhhh No. We returned about 10:30pm after a long day at the park and just wanted to crash... The man in the window then proceeded to ask us for all kinds of information, we weren't checked in, it took another 30 mins to get sorted out, then we get into our room... Decent from first view, UNTIL... we pulled back the comforter and saw the shredded blankets underneath, pulled those off, then we looked at the pillows under the pillowcases and they were covered in slobber stains! We have a habit of bringing a small blanket and our own pillowcases, TYJ! Then while moving our things around a bit, I kicked a pair of shoes, that

Stayed here with my husband and teenage daughter for a Disney trip. Was disappointed at first because of location. It is up and over the I-5 , in a so so neighborhood. Very friendly gentleman at check in. We got room 105. Very nice! It was huge, had hardwood floors, fridge, micro, safe, wifi. Tried walking to and from Disney the first day. Too far and you have to deal with freeway on/off ramps. After that we used the resort shuttle. It's 5 dollars a day and picks up right in front of motel. The route the hotel is on only makes a few other stops so it was great. All and all I would stay here again because of the room. Not sure if all rooms are the same? Plenty of parking and great price!

Summary Heading: Clean, tile floors but nothing special
Summary: The hotel is about a mile or so from Disneyland! It was clean but not anything great! It's a place to sleep and be comfortable! The head board broke on one of the beds when we were checking for bed bugs and there was an old string cheese wrapper too

arrived at anaheim via greyhound coming from san diego had the address discovered that its a walking distance from the station about a 10 minute walk but i did not know that at the time and i took the bus which unfortunately is very unreliable. arrived at about 1 o'clock check inn time was supposed to be at 3 but we were given the room immediately since it was available i checked the room first before being credited for it; the room is large ,king size bed ,a fridge, a tv, coffee maker,the bathroom is large ,clean ,towels were provided a bit course but okay, the sink was outside the bathroom i did not like that, the furniture is old but not bad ac though looks ancient but its in a good condition ,took me some time though to figure out how it works.The breakfast consisted of

Our stay was great!  The staff was friendly, the parking was adequate, the rooms were clean and the beds were relatively comfortable.  The pool and hot tub were pleasant.  Continental breakfast consisted of a variety of donuts, sweet rolls, orange juice, coffee, and apples served in the small lobby, so taking food back to your room is necessary.  The room had laminate wood flooring instead of carpet.  Besides the two queen beds there was a table and two upholstered chairs.  The fridge was a great convenience.  The shower had great water pressure and the towels were the normal white motel style.  There was nothing fancy about this older motel.  For the great price of $65 per night it was a delightful place to collapse and sleep after a full day at Disney or the beach.  It's close

Have stayed here one night.  Checked out the rooms prior to booking in due to reviews seen on here.  Room appeared clean although very dark (windows open up onto car park).  When we went back we explained why we had wanted to see the room first and were given the room that we viewed even though we had been booked into another room (don't know why the change) Fireworks on at 9.30pm and they were cool.  Wifi was hopeless.  Got tired of going to office so didn't go to rectify as only one night. Breakfast was the reported donuts and coffee - from last week.  Fruit appeared OK.

Stayed here as my daughter had a competition in Anaheim. Located around convenient stores, Disney and other good hotels and motels.  Room was big, a/c and heater was old and noisy. Couldnt hear it at the end of a busy and tiring day. Continental breakfast were plainly doughnuts and fruits. Couldnt complain for a budget conscious traveller who needed to stay for 8 nights. Toilet bowl is small.

With all the choices near Disneyland, I should have spent more time researching hotels. This one was run-down, carpets very stained, tile had black grout needing repair.  Breakfasts were not ready at 7am (they told us to come back in 10 minutes but we wanted to get to Disneyland early). The 2nd day we went later and the food was about gone, coffee almost gone and looked old. We decided to go to Starbucks both mornings. The price was fair but I wish I would have found something else, even for more money.  The "15 minute walk" to Disneyland would have been at least a half hour to get to the actual gates. The shuttle cost $5.00. The drive to Disneyland was easy. Free internet was good. I will not return here, nor would I recommend it. There are too many other choices.

Summary Heading: If you want to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: But there are far more better options than this place.  Ok price, but rooms dark and smells of to much air freshener. The "breakfast" was just some donuts on a counter in the reception, and could just as well have been left out in my opinion.   It was also a disappointment that the pool was not heated.  On the plus side:  Helpful and accommodating staff.  Shuttlebus to the park left just outside the door - very nice.  Ok size on the room. Great to see the fireworks from the window

stayed here for a week during our trip to california/disneyland, we checked in around 2am and there was friendly staff -   free breakfast from 7:30am to 9am - breakfast consists of various donuts and danishes, orange juice. The first day there was apples but then i never saw it again. Tip: earlier the better selection, the apples were available when we went around 7:45am, but then all the good donuts would be gone when we went at 8:45am; Bring your own plate and cup so you can take for the family instead of only one or two donuts. Not the most healthy choice but it gets you through the day.  Internet: free wifi - good connection  Parking: free  Rooms: big rooms, we had two double beds which we moved together to make one humongous king bed so my daughter could sleep on the side

Summary Heading: Pleasantly Surprised! Great place to stay and view fireworks
Summary: I needed to be close to the park as I'm here on business. When I drove up I was a but suspicious but I'm here for 2 days and the rate was great. It's close to everything. Check in was very easy. It's only 2 floors so I walked up to my room and WOW! IT was very clean It had 2 Queen beds that are comfortable and the room is huge. It has a fridge, microwave and a large in room safe. The hotel is very secure and has a small continental breakfast downstairs. The bathroom is clean and has lots of space.  This is a perfect place to stay if you are visiting the park. It's a place to crash with lots of room. You can get tickets and shuttle bus to the park as well.  Request a second floor room facing the park as you get a close up view of the fireworks since the hotel is so close.

Great one on one attention.....We loved our stay!...the front desk was more than accomadating to our needs with a smile!  The rooms are very spacious, great for our 2 little kids to run around in.  The view of Disney's fireworks were AMAZING!  The breakfast was nothing big, but enough to settle to get us going.  Highly recommended!

Summary Heading: Clean, affordable... brilliant view of fireworks!
Summary: I always stay here... it's clean, friendly staff, hardwood floors... so much better than carpet floors and best of all - the fireworks view!! Breakfast isn't full continental, but enough to start the day.  Decent walk to disney, or ART shuttle pick up right in front of the hotel for a small fee... Can't ask for anything more!
I enjoyed my stay here. The rooms weren't particularly great by any means, but it was conveniently located. The low price is what makes this a decent stay.

Booked the family room which was two queen beds in the main room with a microwave, Tv, and a small table and chairs, in another room you have a queen bedroom with just a tv. The room was perfect for our family. We had the room on the second floor (rm 219) and had a wonderful view of Disneyland fireworks from the bedroom. They have a pool and hot tub (the hot tub was extreamly hot so we did not get to use it) but it was nice becuase no one was there so the kids got the place to themselves. My only problem was the beds, they are so hard (one of the hardest I have ever seen) which is a shame because that would of made my stay a 5 for sure.   The hotel staff is friendly and its so close to Starbucks and Taco Bell and the shuttle will pick you up in front of the hotel (4 for adults

Summary Heading: Large, average quality room... next to Starbucks.
Summary: I booked this hotel through Hotwire.com, for $86 a night.  The room was very large, had a microwave and a large mini-fridge, which was nice.  The bed was ok, linens were cheap, but after a long day at Disneyland I just needed a place crash so I didn't much mind.  This place was nothing to write home about but I would definitely stay again if I wanted a budget hotel.    It is right next to a Starbucks and a gas station where you can pick up water and snacks for the park which was very convenient.  Also there was a $4 round trip shuttle that picks up in front of the hotel.  If you just miss it walk across Harbor to the hotel on the corner, and you will have enough time to get there to catch it without having to wait 20 minutes.   It was a lot nicer than other budget hotels I have

Stayed here recently and I will say you get what you pay for. It's nothing outrageously priced, which is wonderful for being so close to Disneyland. That said, the low cost means an average room. Nothing awful, but not spectacular either.   The pros: the room was very spacious, perfect for my two toddlers who had pent up energy from being in the car for two 12 hour days. It's within walking distance to Disneyland, approximately 15 minutes. There is a fantastic view of the Disneyland fireworks.  The cons: The carpet is FILTHY. Within a few minutes of walking on it, our feet were completely black. Staff is less than friendly. Not mean, but the guy who checked us in acted like we were a burden for simply checking in. I would think he'd be happy to have our money. There are NO

Summary Heading: Very good value, very good location
Summary: We checked into Astoria late at night.  Our room was spacious, comfortable, clean with a queen bed in which we slept soundly even if our little daughter was sharing it with us.  The rooms are not fancy at all but you have all the required amenities including coffee-making facilities (the coffee in the room doesn't taste good though!), bathroom, sink, hair dryer, TV, phone, alarm clock, air conditioning, a table and chairs - the lot.  Plenty of power sockets as well.  Breakfast was included - donuts, pastries and good coffee - you just have to grab some from the reception on the tray provided in the room and whisk it off to your room.  Parking is very available - as for most of these inns in Anaheim - just next to your room door.  Make sure to get a ground floor room if you have

I was a little apprehensive about this place due to the price of our 2-room family suite.  Some of the negative reviews also had me worried, but after our 2 night stay, I feel we got a good deal; the room was clean and quiet, we slept well, and it is indeed within reasonable walking distance of Disneyland.  Yes, it's about a 15-minute walk, but if you look at other hotels with "maingate" in their names, then look at just how close they actually are to the entrance, you'll see that this is closer than many of them.  Also, the #10 shuttle stops right outside the hotel and takes you right to the park entrance for a small fee; I see someone complained that there is a fee, but it's cheap, and an option if you're too tired or out of shape to walk the short distance.  I've used the

This Hotel was the biggest disappointment. Pictures must not be of the hotel it was soooo dirty walked across carpet feet were black. The hotel blamed it in the fireworks at Disneyland. LOL. Beds were hard as a rock. Please don't waste your time and money go somewhere else.. Great location not walking distance, fireworks were great view from hotel. No free shuttle like they posted. Didn;t stay the whole time left went to a cleaner hotel.

Convenient service, clean room, good mattresses, a cup of coffee ready....just what we needed for a one night girls' get away. We checked in very early, with no difficulties, and spent our day enjoying each other's company at a conference near by.  The free internet made it easy to do a few necessary office chores.  Great value, as always!

This hotel was a huge disappointment.  They advertised as a block from Disneyland,  what they didn't mention is it's a block from the farthest corner.  It's actually about 5 blocks.  They also advertised a hotel shuttle but failed to state is that it is the city shuttle and you have to pay extra for it.  Room was average.  Shower  was terrible-no pressure, beds were hard as rocks, and when we returned from Disneyland at 3pm they still hadn't cleaned our room.  Would not recommend this place to anyone and I'm so thankful we didn't have to spend much time in the room.

Summary Heading: Overall good stay - just what we needed it to be!
Summary: Although we were quite nervous about staying at this hotel based on the reviews of others on this and other websites, it turned out to be fine for what we paid for.    We stayed here for one night in early November 2010 after staying for a week at a timeshare in San Diego prior to staying at a hotel in downtown LA for a conference.  We planned to visit Disneyland for two days and wanted to be close enough that we wouldn't have a long drive ahead of us after visiting the parks all day.  We left the park midday to check in and went with the mindset that if it was too horrible we would find another room somewhere else instead.  When we checked in we were pleasantly surprised!  As many others have mentioned, you are not going to be staying at the Ritz.  However, for $35 a night, we

Summary Heading: Bed creaks like a rusty ship and is hard as a rock while AC clunks when cycling off.
Summary: This is the worst hotel I have ever had the displeasure of staying in. The beds were hard as a rock and creaked like a rusty old ship. The AC clunks when it cycles off shaking the whole wall. It woke me up 3 times. The bed was so hard I had to go to an 24 hr store at 2 a.m. and buy an air mattress and a fan to cool the room as the AC was too loud to use. The wall covering by the sink was peeling off in a big 12 inch section. The shower was completely unsafe as the temperature changed constantly from comfortable to scalding to tepid. My daughter got a burn on her head from one of these temperature changes. When I complained to the front desk they had the nerve to lie and say the mattresses were all brand new. Brand new mattresses do no creak like an old ship. They neglected to

We stayed with Astoria Inn for seven nights and was not only impressed with the price of the three queen room but the staff was great as well. Our maid was the BEST ever.  She went out of her way to make sure all was clean, beds made, and the personal items not disturbed.  We really missed her when we checked into our Las Vegas hotel!!  The front desk staff was very accommodating and answered all questions we posed.  The pool was a bit chilly but the kids still enjoyed it, the hot tub was the perfect temperature and right size for six people to enjoy after a long day at the park.  While we could have walked to Disney, we chose to drive or use the shuttle as we planned to come back during the day to eat and relax.  The walk over the freeway would have been a bit much after dark

Summary Heading: Absolutely Pleased With Room and Service
Summary: I stayed at this Inn for 10 nights, and I am completely satisfied with the quality of the room, and the level of service received from the friendly staff. Our room was clean, stocked with lots of towels, a mini fridge, coffee maker with coffee gounds, tv...everything was great, it made our holiday that much better. There is a shuttle service from the front of the Inn to Disneyland for a lot less then the parking at Disney is...a all day shuttle pass for $4, shuttle runs apx. every 20 mins. The staff/owners were friendly, easy to deal with. I can't say enough as to how happy I am with our stay here.

Summary Heading: tried it twice,never again unless they improve
Summary: This was my second time there, it was only for a few days and I remembered it had cheap prices...what I didn't remember was that the carpet was filthy and that the beds were so old and uncomfortable we would have slept on the floor-but it was too dirty.They had made a few improvements since the last time we were there so there is always hope..The pool was cold but the hot tub was good and yes they had a very clean laundry room to use. Fridge and microwave were real nice and the room was large..so for those things--Yes--it was good. Don't go by what I say, try it for yourself!!!!!!!!!!!!!

was a bit worried having read previous reviews on the cleanliness of this hotel, but it was fine - yes it is very dated and worn around the edges, but our room was very clean, bathroom was spotless and beds were clean and comfortable.  We knew it was budget so clean and comfortable was all we were after. Pool area is not great but did not really use it. It is a good brisk 20 min walk to Disney but there is an ART bus stop right outside which you can use for $4 for an all day pass. The only thing that would put me off staying there again was the location, the walk is far when it is hot, but the view of the Disney fireworks is great!

I was very surprised when we arrived. From the reviews I was not expecting much. We rented a Family suite for 9 days, there were 2 beds in one room and one in a separate room. We had a microwave and refridgerator in the room as well as a coffee pot. The real surprise was that they had an ironing board and a safe in the room. The safe was one that allowed you to program in the code and then reset it when you left.   The pool and spa were open all night and you could see the fireworks at night from Disney. I would stay here every time as it was also reasonably priced for fitting 6 people in it comforably.

We booked last minute for a job interview & 2 days at Disneyland.  The location is one block off Harbor & a straight shot to the parking garage.  The rooms are decent sized.  The beds are rock hard...no give in the mattresses at all.  The carpet was stained & when we put our baby down to crawl around, her feet & knees turned black (not a little bit, but a lot in only 20 minutes).  The babies blankets ended up smelly musty & they got very congested anytime we were in the room.  By the end of the trip, the adults were having the same problems.  The bathroom door wouldn't close.  There was a burnt outlet cover in the room, lack of weather stripping around the room door, and general stains & build up thru out the rest (especially in the bathroom corners).    We complained about the

This hotel was close enough to walk.  I saw a lot of reviews before we left that commented on crossing the highway, and although I wasn't worried for me and my boyfriend thought that it might not be appropriate for children.  The highway crossing is actually a bridge over the highway, and although it is located on busy streets it is definitely not right on the highway.  It was wonderfully close to Disney, tons of restaurants and transportation was easy to figure out to get around Anaheim.  The hot tub was kept warm enough and after long days of travelling or playing we definitely enjoyed soaking for a bit.  My only complaint was that the rooms were a little worn and run down, they just felt overused and I am not generally a picky traveller.  Overall though the whole place and

What I wanted: a good place to stay within walking distance to Disneyland. And I got it!  Finding It: This Inn is easy to find, one short block off Harbor Blvd. The sign is high and clear, and the check-in is very close to the regular parking spaces. The check-in process was quick and painless.  Settling In: there were spacious drawers into which to put our clothes, and the fridge is not one of those tiny dorm-room types, but the taller kind (still with the freezer inside the main compartment with the little flip-down door). It and the two-speed, twist-dial microwave worked well our whole visit.  Amenities: The big CRT TV has about 12 cable channels and a remote. The sink and towel area, which is not separated by a door, has a spacious sink, a 4-cup coffee maker, ice bucket,

My wife and I stayed at the Astoria for 4 nights and found it perfect for us. We were looking for a basic hotel for a good price and the Astoria is exactly that. It is a nice, quiet little hotel with incredibly friendly staff. The staff was very helpful on numerous occassions. From leaving the pool open a little later at night to helping us deal with our annoying airport shuttle, the staff at the Astoria was extremely helpful. My wife and I are a young couple with no kids so we had no problems with the approx 20 minute walk to Disneyland. In summary, the Astoria is a tremendous value for what you pay. If you are on a budget like we were, the Astoria is a great option.

Summary Heading: It muchhh worths the money you give
Summary: Firstly the inn is placed on a very nice place which is quite near to the anaheim disneyland. maybe it is not like a five star hotel but obviously when we consider the overall service, swimming facility, and location you will agree that this place is great to stay with this price. For me this place is much better than a average Ramada hotel; tv, refregirator, wi-fi, a iron with its table, even microwave is available. but the greatest part of this place is its swimming pool and spa jakuzi where noone exists, its just like yours :P , shortly nice place to stay, especially if you're planning to go to disneyland.

Summary Heading: Little hole in the wall with a great price!!
Summary: We stayed here after our first choice hotel had apparently been torn down! This hotel is a great little hole in the wall. We drove past it once, as the driveway is easy to miss.   Our walk in rate was $60 for a king room. The room was huge, and very clean! It had a walk through closet that led to the bath room. There was also a jacuzzi tub in the room! I sadly didn't get to use it though!  They have a great pool, and hot tub with some descent patio furniture around it. The pool was very clean, and the hotel was virtually empty!  There was some major room renos in progress, but we really didn't even notice.   I thought this was a really great hotel for the price, and would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Great price for this time of year!
Summary: To be honest, we didn't have much choice in hotels as we booked last minute.  However, from the $200 plus rates we were getting for hotels and motels infront of Disneyland, to the $80 rate we got from this hotel/motel... we can't complain with what we got!  The staff are very nice and polite.  The lady at the front desk was especially nice and catered to our requirements.  She was ever happy to help us organize ourselves and gave us all the information we needed to get around.   The housekeeping staff are equally friendly and did a grand job of cleaning up after us everyday.  All in all, the experience was perfect.  The view of Disney's fireworks is a treat - most of the hotel guests would come out to the balcony and others would be seen in the hot-tub by the pool watching the

Summary Heading: Don't forget to bring your slippers!
Summary: Overall, our stay at this motel was acceptable, however, there were two minor issues:    We were unable to use the bathtub because the drain stopper/plug  would not properly seal, had to take showers instead.  The second complaint we had was that our room had very filthy carpeting.  After walking around barefoot in our room during the first night,  the soles of our feet were all black!  Slippers are definitely a must at this motel.  Other than these two issues,  everything else seemed okay.  The hairdryer, microwave oven, & mini-refrigerator all worked okay.  The motel also provides a free continental breakfast.

Summary Heading: Good location, great manager, nice pool and hot tub - budget
Summary: OK, here is the deal - try and book somewhere last minute within walking distance from Disney during spring break... either all full or at least $180 a night. At least. The same will surely apply during other busy times.  It's a motel and that's what you get. Our room was large (twin Queen) and clean. It's not 4 star but then it doesn't claim to be. TV is big and good signal, bathroom is clean and basic. Shower is great. There is a large table and chairs for working on (laptop etc). Smoking rooms are available. Free Wifi (fast). Free parking (well, a motel should have!)  The manager is a lovely girl who went out of her way to help us with a few queries about the area we had.  The pool and hot tub were spotless, although the area around it was grubby with a small amount of litter

Very disappointed with the location..walking over the 14 lane freeway to get to the better side of Harbour blvd - where Disneyland is - was a bit scary , especially on returning after dark.....  Changed room after nearly getting electrocuted by hairdryer which was only held together by scotchtape....only to have the same kind of hairdryer in the next room!!  Had an old dirty ironing board , asked repeatedly for an iron, and even by the 4th day, never got one!!  Breakfast is horrible - donuts and oj - and only served after 8:00 am.. better off going to Starbucks around the corner or to IHOP...  Next time, will definitely pay more and get better " Hotel" closer to every thing... t.

Summary Heading: Small, cozy and very friendly staff
Summary: One would think a small motel will have little to offer, but we were pleasantly suprised with this one! The staff were very friendly and accomodating.  We chose to upgrade our room - which they arranged for us.  The motel was full almost everynight, but they spent time with us to move reservations around and accomodate our needs.  The walk to Disney isn't as bad as others make out in previous reviews - however, after a day at the park, coming back maybe more strenuous than going!  But the shuttle is a frontdoor pick-up, and it's only $3 for a whole day!  Can't whine about that! Fireworks view is unimaginable!  We had a excellent view, and others also hung out with us as we watched from our balcony.  The pool is small, but we weren't there for the pool, it was perfect for an

Ok, my trip to Disneyland was GREAT!  But this review is of the Hotel!  House keeping SUCKED!  Hello, we found a used ... yes used condom wrapper right next to our bed when we checked into the room.  ALSO, when we left to go to the park we put the sign on the door that said "Maid Service"  AND we left the a/c on.  Upon our return, the "maid service" sign was switched around to "do not disturb" AND our a/c was off.  SO WHO WAS IN OUR ROOM????  I just think the maid service was too lazy to do there job.  They also have the audacity to have a envelope next to the bed that asks for a tip for the maids ... here is a tip LEARN TO CLEAN!   What bugs me the most is someone was in the room .. so if it supposedly always said "do not disturb" who turned off the a/c, and TRUST ME i left

This motel is a good last  resort if you can't find anything across the street from Disneyland.  It's a bit run down, but it was clean.  It has a small pool.  The hotels description says it is a block away from Disneyland, but is more like half a mile away.  It is walkable if you don't want to pay the parking lot fee, but be prepared.  Also don't be mislead by the continental breakfast, some donuts and toast.

The hotel was clean enough. It was shabby, furniture stained and worn. Blankets were almost paper thin. Bed WAY too soft I could not get comfortable at all (and I usually dont mind soft beds).  Worst part the smell. It was horrible. They must have "renovated" by painting over mildew. And then they cover up the mold smell with a god awful air freshener. Smelled like old lady's house and mothballs. Really nauseating. When we got home we had to wash all our clothes - even the stuff we did not wear and that were clean - because the smell of the room permeated everything.   Do Not Stay Here At All.   I know the price and convenience look good but it really was bad. We did not spend much time in the room but dreaded going back there every night.  Would have switched hotels but Hubby

I would not recommend this motel and obviously not stay here again.  The cleanliness was not ok. That same little french fry I saw on the floor by the bed on day 3 was still there on day 8.  We never had fries.  The outdoor pool area was disgusting.  The pool was freezing.  Although we were out most of the time, it would have been better at a cleaner place.  They were right about the fireworks, though.  Not enough to enjoy our stay.

Yes i am in total agreement with the last comment this hotel was well keep, and the room were clean. Our beds were always made when we came back to the Hotel.  Manny the manager and family were freindly helpful and very informative. We stayed six nights, the continental breakfest is basic with donuts, toast, orange juice and coffee. We booked over expedia, but maybe rates might be better if you can contact the hotel direct, not sure.  I would definitely recommend this hotel, for whoever  is staying in Anaheim Disneyland and looking for a budget price.  The traffic indicated by others didn't bother us because the windows are fairly new.  Also having a microwave and fridge in the room made it convienent to make simply meals.  A mexican grocery store 2 blocks down the street at

There are so many places to stay near Disneyland that picking one seems a formidable task. Trip Advisor certainly helps and reading the reviews was valuable.  The Astoria is exactly 1.2 miles walking from the main entrance. While I am a daily walker, we used the ART anyway because we knew we would log many miles in the park and be tired at day's end. Our grandaughter and my wife used the pool and it satisfied her, and the spa pool relaxed me after a long day at the park.  The ART stops right out front and is a short ride on the "A" route. For $3.00 per day/per person, unlimited trips, it is worthwhile. You can purchase the advance pass at the desk (they do not sell passes on the bus, only cash $1.50 fares).  The manager, Manny, was most cooperative and friendly. Because we

I had quite a time trying to find a reasonably priced yet nice hotel in the Disneyland area. I was apprehensive to try the Astoria Inn and Suites considering it received mixed reviews, however I was pleasantly surprised when my family and I showed up at the hotel.   Even though the hotel is located on a busy street and right off of the freeway, we did not hear too much traffic (we were on the second floor and our parents were on the first). For people who have a problem sleeping, I would suggest a room towards the back of the hotel (just in case!). At check in, the receptionist was pleasant and offered to sell us tickets to any of the amusement parks- some at a discounted price. The room itself was very clean, though the bathtub drain was clogged (we didn't call about it because

WE stayed at THE ASTORIA INN four days, was nice two bedroom with three queen beds, perfect for large families of six or more.  Location is a little misleading, I was told one block was about three blocks.  Continental breakast is limited there was not enough oj or coffee, you would probably have to wake up extra early just for that, which was not worth it.  There is a gas station around the corner to purchase coffee and snacks.  Service was nice and friendly, had a minor problem with bathroom door wouldnt close sometimes.  There is a nice view of the fireworks,which we enjoyed very much.  Room looked nice clean, but I did run into a few bugs in there.  I guess you get what you paid for, next time we go to disneyland we will probably stay somewhere else for a little more.

I satyed at the astora during the easter break. I found i to be a very friendly place in a great location. I also found that the rooms were a good size and were always kept clean. However, the best part was the great view of the disney world fireworks every night. I would definately stay there again

Five days at this suberb hotel made my holiday with friends fantasic. Brilliant value for money, swimming pool less than 20m away, parking facilities and within driving distance from all the top tourist destinations to visit in LA - what more could you ask for? Well, hot beverages and danish pastrys in the morning along with a warm service and a smile was the icing on the cake. There was such a friendly, family atmosphere that it really felt like home away from home. Best of all, five days of disney fireworks for free on the balcony!

Excellent location with great views of the fireworks in the evening... only minutes walk from Disneyland also very close to essentials (eg Taco Bell and IHOP!)  The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly making our stay there a home from home.  Great choice of motel, would recommend wholeheartedly.

I was more than pleasantly surprised by this fantastic little find!  My first time in LA, and although the weather was miserable, the staff were anything but.  They were outstandingly helpful and always friendly, they even helped and advised us on the best places to eat and go out, even got tickets to a live recording of the Jay Leno Show based on their advice! The rooms were great, clean and well stocked with all the essentials.  I found the location to be ideal and would highly recommend a stay here, best of all you get a fantastic view of the fireworks at Disney; I watched the show 3 days in a row, for free!

Summary Heading: no quiffs, no troubles, great stay and holiday!
Summary: If you want to go to Disney and don't want to spend an arm and a leg on accommodation, then there's only a handful of motels/hotels that will give you an excellent level of quality and service for an excellent price - Anaheim Astoria Inn & Suites is one of these places. I've been to plenty of hotels/motels in the States and just because the room is nice doens't mean your stay will be too. The management I found to be very friendly, they even helped us with accommodation along the west coast and hired cars etc. and all with a friendly smile. Sure you can spend a bit more and go for something a bit more swish, but we all found real value for money here (especially since there were so many kids with us, family rooms were great!) and the location was also perfect for Disney and

Great facilities and even better service. The folks at the hotel proved to be excellent hosts, always at hand to facilitate bookings for local attractions and offering advice when needed. Highly recommended for any future visitors to the area.

Summary Heading: Great Fireworks view, clean and cozy!
Summary: We spent 5 nights at the Astoria and we loved it.  We had one of their family rooms which gave us so much more space than other big hotels have done in the past.  The room has tv's in both rooms of the suite and nice microwave and fridge.  We had a hairdryer with a built in nightlight which was perfect for the kids in the middle of the night. The pool is small, but clean and the jacuzzi is perfect after a long day at D-land! The continental is enough to start the day off, there's always McDonalds around the corner if you're in need of something more, but the toast and danish did it for me!  Manny and Neelam are such a nice couple, they were always there to help us, even for extra towels in the middle of the night! We will definetely stay there again!

My husband and I were very pleased with our stay. The staff was helpfull and very polite each time I spoke to them.  The rooms were in great shape.  The shuttle to Disneyland picked you up and dropped you off right infront of the hotel.  If you are looking for great rooms, low prices and a friendly face stay here!!!!!

my family just stayed there for one week, our first night there we asked for a extra pillow house keeping had it there with in 5 minutes, the pool was great after spending a hot day at D-land, the spa was very well heated. trasportation to the park was not a problem we took the trolly that picks up every 20 mins and runs after the park closes. My kids loved the fact that they could watch the  disney land fireworks right from our rooms balcony. house keeping came in and cleaned our room everyday and the breakfast was great consisted of donuts and orange juice i seen the donuts delivered to the lobby in the morning so they were fresh. if you are looking for an upscale motel then this would not be your place but if you are wanting a nice clean room with a great price and friendly

I stayed here last year and was horribly disgusted!  My sister liked the price of this not well-known hotel even though I heard about the rave reviews of Howard Johnson and that their prices were reasonable.  I grudingly agreed to stay here.  First night, first thing was the shabby rundown room.  I went to the bathroom and could not stand the stench.  While standing in the bathroom I then observed a LINE of ants coming from the window down the bathtub out the door.  Then when I turned down the sheets to go to sleep I noticed hair and dirt on them.  Angry and upset by this time I contacted housekeeping about it and it took them well over an hour to change the sheets.   The next morning after a greasy, cold, day-old doughnut as our "Continental Breakfast," we took the remaining

Summary Heading: Great stay, will stay here again
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 4 nights in February 2005.  Our room was nice, clean.  The room was in such good shape, I assume it had been refurbished recently.  Beds were comfy, refrigerator and microwave worked well.  The only negatives I have to say were that the carpet needed to be shampooed and the pool was not heated.  However, the spa was great which is what we needed after long days at D-land.  We bought passes for the Anaheim Resort Transit trolley which picked us up and dropped us off at the intersection about 1/2 block away.  ART was clean and reliable, safe.  Other guests told me they walked to the park but I thought that it was a little too far w/children.  We will stay here again.

Horrible Location. the rooms were filthy. we had to change rooms twice because our shower was covered in dirt. it was no where near disneyland. in order to get there you had to cross a horrible intersection, go over the freeway overpass, AND still walk a long distance to the park. The ONE staff person i saw the whole time i was there was pretty nice, but it was starnge only seeing ONE staff member. i wouldnt stay there again.
